td.span: since it seems to enforce the google style guide for Java.-->
<!-- This is a checkstyle configuration file. For descriptions of
what the following rules do, please see the checkstyle configuration
<!-- Checks that there are no tab characters in the file.
<!-- Checks that FIXME is not used in comments. TODO is preferred.
'TODO is preferred to FIXME. e.g. "TODO(royw): Refactor when v2 is released."'
<!-- Checks that TODOs are named. (Actually, just that they are followed
'All TODOs should be named. e.g. "TODO(royw): Refactor when v2 is released."'
"Lines may not have a trailing whitespace."
"The package junit.framework belongs to JUnit v3. Use org.junit instead."
<!-- All Java AST specific tests live under TreeWalker module. -->
<!-- Checks for out of order import statements. -->
<!-- Turn off import ordering until we can get IntelliJ to do the right
<!-- This ensures that static imports go first. -->
<!-- Item 38 - Adhere to generally accepted naming conventions -->
<!-- Validates identifiers for package names against the
<!-- Here the default checkstyle rule restricts package name parts to
seven characters, this is not in line with common practice at Google.
<!-- Validates static, final fields against the
<!-- Validates non-private, static, final fields against the supplied
"Variable ''{0}'' should be in ALL_CAPS (if it is a constant) or be private (otherwise)."
<!-- Validates non-static members against the supplied expression. -->
<!-- Validates identifiers for method parameters against the
<!-- Validates identifiers for local final variables against the
<!-- Validates identifiers for local variables against the
<!-- Checks if a line is too long. -->
The default ignore pattern exempts the following elements:
<!-- Checks for placement of the left curly brace ('{'). -->
<!-- Checks right curlies on CATCH, ELSE, and TRY blocks are on
the same line. e.g., the following example is fine:
<!-- This next example is not fine:
<!-- Checks for braces around if and else blocks -->
<!-- Checks that long constants are defined with an upper ell.-->
<!-- Warn about falling through to the next case statement. Similar to
javac -Xlint:fallthrough, but the check is suppressed if a single-line comment
on the last non-blank line preceding the fallen-into case contains 'fall through' (or
some other variants which we don't publicized to promote consistency).
"fall through|Fall through|fallthru|Fallthru|falls through|Falls through|fallthrough|Fallthrough|No break|NO break|no break|continue on"
<!-- Warn if modifier order is inconsistent with JLS3 8.1.1, 8.3.1, and
public, protected, private, abstract, static, final, transient, volatile,
<!-- Checks that various tokens are surrounded by whitespace.
This includes most binary operators and keywords followed
BOR_ASSIGN, BSR, BSR_ASSIGN, BXOR, BXOR_ASSIGN, COLON, DIV, DIV_ASSIGN,
EQUAL, GE, GT, LAND, LE, LITERAL_CATCH, LITERAL_DO, LITERAL_ELSE,
LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED, LITERAL_TRY, LITERAL_WHILE, LOR, LT, MINUS,
MINUS_ASSIGN, MOD, MOD_ASSIGN, NOT_EQUAL, PLUS, PLUS_ASSIGN, QUESTION,
<!-- Checks that commas, semicolons and typecasts are followed by
<!-- Checks that there is no whitespace after various unary operators.
<!-- Checks that there is no whitespace before various unary operators.
<!-- Checks that there is no whitespace before close parens or after
BOR_ASSIGN, BSR, BSR_ASSIGN, BXOR, BXOR_ASSIGN, DIV, DIV_ASSIGN,
